page.title: 01Earl's Seat and Rabbit Crag
page.content:
{General overview:} Apart from a settlement at{Bellingburn {Head}and a small area of open moorland, the slopes of{Earl's Seat, {Rabbit Crag, Millstone Crag and Long {Rigg}are now softened and disguised by the Forestry Commission's plantations. Forest Roads give access to the upper slopes, where{Earl's Seat}rises to 397 metres above sea level. The craggy outcrops at{Rabbit Crags {and Harper Crag}are now hidden from distant view. Sheep graze on the heather and grass moorland beyond the Forest fences.
As in other parts of the forest,{roe {deer}wander and forage.
